description: /b/Pressure Chambers/b/ are large /b/Compressed Air/b/ containers. These are kind of like your batteries.
/6/Items can also be processed/6/ as long as /b/Pressure Chamber Interfaces/b/ were installed. Input/output for /b/Interfaces/b/ can /c/only be done via hopper or funnel/c/.
You may notice your pressure drop when one of these is added to your network. This is normal.

/b/Pressure/b/ is based off of /6/the ratio of/6/ /b/Air/b/ to /b/Volume/b/. The more volume you have, the more air you need for higher pressure. /b/Pressure Chambers/b/ have lots of /b/volume/b/. But this isn't a bad thing. While /6/machines have a minimum pressure requirement/6/, they always /6/consume a flat amount of air/6/. The more air you have, the/b/ longer they can run/b/, but the /6/more air you'll need to mantain a set pressure/6/.
Oh and /c/do not exceed the maximum pressure/c/. These are only rated for a certain pressure, anything more might cause... unwanted explosions.
